code:
d: the date of the month without the prefix 0, for example 12.

dd: date of the month in two digits, for example 12.

M: month of the year, for example 7.

MM: a month in a year in two digits, for example 07.

MMM: the name of the month of the year, displayed as an abbreviation of three letters, for example, July.

MMMM: The month of the year is displayed as the full name of the month, for example, July.

MMMMM: the name of the first letter of the month, for example J.

y: year, for example, 2017.

yy: the last two digits of the year, for example, 17.

yyyy: year, for example, 2017.

h: hour per day in 12-hour format, for example 5.

hh: an hour per day in two digits, for example 05.

H: hourly per day in 24-hour format, for example, 17.

HH: hour per day 24-hour format in two digits.

m: minutes per hour.

mm: minutes per hour in two digits.

s: seconds per minute.

ss: seconds per minute in two digits.

S: displays 1/10 of a second in the second.

SS: displays two digits of 1/100 second.

SSS: displays milliseconds in the second.

a: displays AM / PM.

G: era, for example, AD.

w: Displays the week of the year.

W: Displays the week in the month.

D: day of the year.

F: the day of the week in the month, for example, 2 for the date specified above, since this is the second Wednesday of the month.

E: abbreviation of the day, for example, Mon.

EEE: the abbreviation of the day, for example, Sub.

EEEE: the full name of the day, for example, Wednesday.

EEEEE: the name of the first letter of the day, for example P.

k: an hour a day, the same as H.

K: an hour per day in a 12-hour format, the same as h.

z: time zone, for example, GMT + 05: 30.

Z: time zone, for example +0530.

c: displays the name of the day, the same as E.

L: month of the year. The same as M.
